duck: asymptotic curve - In the differential geometry of surfaces, an asymptotic curve is a curve always tangent to an asymptotic direction of the surface.
Asymptotic theory - Asymptotic theory or large-sample theory is the branch of mathematics which studies asymptotic expansions.

Asymptotic computational complexity - In computational complexity theory, asymptotic computational complexity is the usage of the asymptotic analysis for the estimation of computational complexity of algorithms and computational pr...
In mathematical analysis, asymptotic analysis is a method of describing limiting behavior.

wiki.text:
In mathematical analysis, 'asymptotic analysis' is a method of describing
limiting behavior. The methodology has applications across science. Examples are
* in computer science in the analysis of algorithms, considering the performance
  of algorithms when applied to very large input datasets.
* the behavior of physical systems when they are very large.
* in accident analysis when identifying the causation of crash through count
  modeling with large number of crash counts in a given time and space. The
  simplest example is, when considering a function f(n), there is a need to
  describe its properties when n becomes very large. Thus, if f(n) =
  n<sup>2</sup>+3n, the term 3n becomes insignificant compared to n<sup>2</sup>
  when n is very large. The function "f(n) is said to be asymptotically
  equivalent to n<sup>2</sup> as n → ∞", and this is written symbolically as
  f(n) ~ n<sup>2</sup>.
wiki.title: asymptotic%20analysis
